node.title: ‘You’re not bouncy enough to have ADHD’: Australian school kids say ADHD is severely misunderstood
node.description: ADHD affects one in 20 Australian children, which means, statistically, there is a child with ADHD in every single classroom in the country. But a recent study shows 55 per cent of teachers do not have adequate training on managing ADHD in the classroom.

node.title: 'There have been rumours': Why the next two years could decide the fate of Kim Jong Un
node.description: North Korea claims to have been COVID-free for the duration of the pandemic. But recent events south of the border could have major implications for the secretive nation and its enigmatic ruler.

node.title: House prices depend on interest rates: As one goes up, the other will fall
node.description: House price falls are all but baked in as interest rates start rising over the next couple of years. How much prices fall mainly depends on how high and quickly borrowing costs end up rising, writes Michael Janda.

node.title: Omicron 'may already be here in Australia'. Experts say there's more we can do to stop COVID
node.description: The emergence of the Omicron variant of coronavirus shows Africa needs greater access to vaccines, experts say. There are also warnings we shouldn't give up masks, social distancing or contact tracing in Australia.

node.title: Chris Christie Touts 'Talent' to Be President, Undaunted by Trump Hinting at 2024 Run
node.description: The former Republican governor of New Jersey said he's "not ready to retire."

node.title: Michael never told anyone about the thoughts in his head until they landed him in prison
node.description: All Michael wanted as a kid was for the bad thoughts to go away. And one day they did, but the reason why led him down a dark path.

node.title: Fauci says he "would not be surprised" if new COVID variant is in U.S.
node.description: "When you have a virus like this, it almost invariably is ultimately going to go essentially all over," Fauci said.

node.title: Mets Owner Blasts Agent Over Matz’s Decision to Sign Elsewhere
node.description: The club hoped Steven Matz would return after rejuvenating his career in Toronto. Much to Steven Cohen’s chagrin, Matz chose St. Louis instead.

node.title: A Tale of Culinary Reconciliation, Beside the Eiffel Tower
node.description: Two decades ago, Spain was the new France, leading gastronomic innovation. Now two iconic chefs have joined forces in Paris.

node.title: How an ancient message shows the path to protecting Aboriginal communities from COVID-19
node.description: If the urgent problems fuelling COVID-19 outbreaks in Indigenous communities aren't addressed, things will continue to go poorly for First Nations people across Australia, writes Tynan King.

node.title: What do Australia's great novels have in common?
node.description: A new three-part documentary series puts Australian literature firmly in the spotlight, and asks the question: can books help us understand our country?

node.title: Why Adele's imperfect voice sets her apart
node.description: Adele's voice is soulful, rich and powerful – but it is in her vulnerability we can really see what an incredible artist she is, writes Narelle Yeo.

node.title: Australia is at the crosshairs of a big shift, as the tussle with China over the Pacific steps up a level
node.description: The Pacific Islands are in the front line of Xi Jinping's vision of the China Dream: China as the unrivalled regional power. Unrest in the Solomon Islands shows us what happens when the balance of power shifts and security and order can no longer be guaranteed, writes Stan Grant.

node.title: Covid-19: 145 new community cases in New Zealand today, one further death
node.description: There have been 145 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand reported by the Ministry of Health today.

node.title: Stream These 7 Productions That Celebrate Stephen Sondheim’s Work
node.description: Here’s a guide to films, documentaries and other productions that provide insight into the composer-lyricist’s sly wit and melodic acumen.

node.title: Get to Know Sondheim’s Best in These 10 Videos
node.description: Jake Gyllenhaal, Patti LuPone, Judi Dench and an all-star Zoom trio find the wit, pathos and heartbreak in a remarkable songbook.

node.title: Democrats Struggle to Energize Their Base as Frustrations Mount
node.description: Even as President Biden achieves some significant victories, Democrats are warning that many of their most loyal supporters see inaction and broken campaign promises.

node.title: Russia's Military Buildup Next to Ukraine May Force Joe Biden's Hand
node.description: NATO has asked Russia to "reduce tensions and de-escalate" as Kyiv increases its calls to join the U.S-led alliance to counter the threat from Moscow.

node.title: Omicron Variant: Germany, Czech Republic Report Suspected Cases After U.K. Confirmation
node.description: Several countries, including the U.S., Japan and Israel, have announced travel restrictions to avoid the mass spread of the latest COVID variant.

node.title: The history of the Brooklyn Bridge: "An iconic piece of New York City and beyond"
node.description: When it was completed in 1883, it was hailed as an engineering marvel and called the eighth Wonder of the World.

node.title: LeBron James fined $15,000 for making an "obscene gesture"
node.description: The incident comes days after James was suspended for an on-court altercation involving Detroit Pistons center Isaiah Stewart.

node.title: How Austin Became One of the Least Affordable Cities in America
node.description: The capital of Texas has long been an attractive place to call home. But with an average of 180 new residents a day arriving, its popularity has created a brewing housing crisis that is reshaping the city.

node.title: 20-30 Thieves Ransack Minnesota Best Buy Store on Black Friday as Mass Robberies Spread
node.description: The incident comes after Best Buy said this week that organized theft has been impacting its bottom line.

node.title: Adam Kinzinger Accuses McCarthy of 'Begging' Marjorie Taylor Greene to 'Stay in Power'
node.description: The Illinois Republican knocked the House GOP leader, writing in a sarcastic tweet: "Here is real strength."

node.title: Cycling NZ on the skids again
node.description: Cycling New Zealand is embroiled in more high performance issues, revealing it breached rules over athlete selection while at the Tokyo Olympics but won't say how or who the riders involved were.

node.title: Book excerpt: "Apparently There Were Complaints" by Sharon Gless
node.description: In her new memoir, the Emmy-winning star of "Cagney & Lacey" writes about a terrifying medical incident that would end her relationship with martinis.

node.title: Why Space Tourists Won’t Find the Awe They Seek
node.description: Space tourism is one of those ostensibly awesome experiences that often feel anticlimactic because they promise the sublime.

node.title: To Protect Abortion Rights, Turn to Elections
node.description: Conservatives may still end up unhappy with a court they now control.

node.title: Seeking Cures for Chronic Illness
node.description: Readers react to Ross Douthat’s account of his health travails and the exotic treatments he tried.

node.title: Impromptu Sondheim Wakes Fill Piano Bars With Tears and Tunes
node.description: Lines of Stephen Sondheim fans formed outside Marie’s Crisis Cafe in Greenwich Village as news of his death spread. Inside, it was all-Sondheim on the piano.
